content.question: The diagram above shows the forces exerted on an object. Which of the following dot diagrams best represents the position of the object at equal time intervals?

choices.label: The figure presents a dot diagram showing the position of the object at 6 equal time intervals. In each of the 6 time intervals, the object moves directly to the right by a constant amount of distance.

The figure presents a dot diagram showing the position of the object at 6 equal time intervals. For each time interval, the object moves directly to the right by a larger amount of distance than it did in the previous time interval.

The figure presents a dot diagram showing the position of the object at 6 equal time intervals. For each time interval, the object moves directly to the right by a smaller amount of distance than it did in the previous time interval.

The figure presents a dot diagram showing the position of the object at 6 equal time intervals. In each of the 6 time intervals, the object moves to the right by a constant amount. In addition to the horizontal movement, for each time interval the object moves downward by a larger amount than it did in the previous time interval.

content.answer: The figure presents a dot diagram showing the position of the object at 6 equal time intervals. For each time interval, the object moves directly to the right by a larger amount of distance than it did in the previous time interval.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
